title: Assassins shouldn't be able to just 1v2 freely. Stop asking for it.
body:
With all the complaining going on about supports, I find it hard to ignore some...lopsided logic that recurs in the conversation.

Like, assassins complain that they can't assassinate when a support is there, right? But supports are *supposed* to stop assassinations, and are *supposed* to not fight people straight up. If we don't want supports to fight well,  or wave clear well, so they stick to supporting and saving carries, how can you complain when they do the one thing they're supposed to do? I'm not saying supports "can't be op", but the notion that an assassin should just run in your shit and win what's essentially a 1v2 is fucking ridiculous.

If I'm a support, and I'm doing my job, and you're an assassin, **it's my job to watch out for you.** Your team should be helping to make an opening for you to pick someone off. Maybe that someone isn't the adc specifically? Maybe it's the enemy mid laner? Maybe it's a low health jungler? Maybe that someone is **me?** Idk, but the relationship between me and an assassin is literally an inverse relationship: If you're doing your job well when I'm in interaction range of you, I'm doing my job poorly, and if you're getting caught in bubbles or running into shields over and over again, you're doing a shit job of picking targets and openings. That's how I see it. Sure, some champs need addressing with this in mind, and sure, some champs are inherently better or worse at stopping certain types of threats outright, but generally speaking, I think there's other issues that create pain points for the assassin vs. support experience, and just mindlessly blaming the whole role when it only has a few outlier offenders (Janna and Kench are prime examples, as well as Redemption and Locket, Redemption being a bit less so, though) isn't a fair narrative, period.

Just trying to add a dose of sanity to the discussion.

replies.body:
Here's the thing: This isn't a PvE game. You can't just "Assassin's Creed" someone without me noticing. If I see an assassin, I'm saving either Exhaust or ult for when I see him making a move. You need to use your kit to find an opening and hit someone that's vulnerable. THAT'S the point. You slam down on vulnerable targets. Someone that's got someone watching over them with buffs and hard cc on standby ISN'T VULNERABLE unless you're so fed that they can't react quick enough to stop you.

So if you wanna take that chance, take it, but if you die cause your damage is cut by Exhaust and you couldn't make your getaway before getting held down and clicked on, you can't blame me for doing what I'm supposed to do to you. Or...go for my mid laner. Or wait for me to use some cds and THEN fly in. You can make more out of the situation than you think you can, just like how I can hold my own cds until I see key targets move first.

Nobody who actually wants balance wants assassin's to burst through the entire supports kit+exhaust. They may however want supports to have something besides 100% uptime on shields plus a plethora of hard and soft cc + exhaust on a lower cooldown then most other ss  due to some supports running summoner CD reductions. They may also want ways to outplay the support and win a 1v2 by out Skilling. And they may want to not die in 2-3 autos to the adc in the likely event they don't 1 shot him/her. 

If you feel like all of this is unfair to ask for then you need to readjust your version of balance. 

Supports are way way way way way to fucking strong right now. And there is nothing assassin's can really do against a competent -actual- support. (not counting troll shit like velkoz, lux, brand, and other shit like that)

If they don't have that, what do they have?

Gonna use Talon as a go-to example though this can apply to pretty much all assassins. Talon's Ult CD has at max 60 seconds, minus whatever CDR he gets, and does undodgeable damage if you land a single hit on a target. All his other cooldowns are about as low as anyone else's. His item cooldowns are about even as anyone else's. He has access to invisibility, dashes and massive burst damage.

Flipside, supports have access to similarly powerful items with similarly long cooldowns. The shield stacking IS an issue still. Cooldowns from support kits tend to be even to those of assassins, with the exception of ultimates. Taking Sona as the example here; her ult is on a 100 seconds cooldown. 40 more than Talon's with a major chance to miss due to the assassin's mobility/invisibility/untargetability. Janna? 120 seconds. Double Talon's. Nami also 100. That means even if you waste your ult because the enemy support did the same to counter you, you're back online faster and get to have a chance to come back.

Your ignite versus their exhaust. If you're worried the ADC might kill you too fast if you get counteracted, you may want to get exhaust yourself.

The damage output by ADCs IS an issue. You shouldn't get instantly annihilated by a damage per second class regardless of whether you fucked up your assassination or not. But if a support used their kit to counter yours, the end result should be null. If the support countered your kit and there happens to be someone else with them ready to fuck you over, then yeah, team game fam.

The issue isn't shield stacking. It's shield duration. (also a mobility spell or flash negates over 50% of talons burst. Return hit from w and passive bleed. Unless you allowed him to walk up unstealthed and land wqr on you. Which would just be stupid.) 

Shields on average are around 500-600 hp late game. (210 base for Janna with 200-250 ap is + 140-170 so 360 x 30-40% because of % shields. + Aery. Janna with 45% cdr has a .5 second downtime. Lulu has .5 seconds when it's off cooldown and still effective. Karma's is like 3.6 seconds with a 4 second uptime. Plus mantra which makes hers like 1k hp of a shield. Add in locket and redemption and a cleanse and all this other shit. It's fine. Just give the damn assassin's a window to even go in. (no .5 seconds on Janna doesn't  count due to burst windows being 1.5 seconds.) 

So either half the shield duration (what I'm in favor of) or double the cooldown (I feel like this is the worse option because it removed way more power then the other)

If it means they get stronger AP ratios on their offensive abilities, sure why not. Can't just remove power like that and expect them not to take a monumental winrate dive. I do agree on shields either being too strong or lasting too long (or in sona's case neither of these things unless she's scaled way up).
Then you get solo lane supports.

I have zero problem with solo lane supports if they still pay for it by being at a disadvantage against their solo laners (worse waveclear, less kill potential, worse roaming for examples) in exchange for better teamfight power and utility later. In their *current* form there'd certainly be issues, but those can be smoothed over with balance passes.
Solo lane Supports are only ok when their utility doesn't work on themselves, otherwise they're uninteractive in lane. Good luck killing a Lulu through her W and R solo.

The issue with making supports unable to 'utility' themselves is it negates huge parts of their kits and potential plays. That it works *worse* on themselves than others, or works better the more people there are, sure, i can see it.

Another way would be to raise their cooldowns or lower effect durations at lower ability levels to ensure the solo support chooses between safety and waveclear.

Riot has done a lot of power shaving from both supports and supports items in recent patches, to the point where a good deal of champs and items are weaker than they were before even the Ardent meta if we're going by numbers.

Also, **this is a 1v2 scenario.** If you manage to get a kill and not die in this instance, you didn't just "outskill the support", but you also outskilled the adc (unless you're so fed you just skip the skill check and murder them in .1 seconds). It'd be a MASSIVE failure on my and my adc's part if you came out on top going into 2 people by yourself. REALLY consider what you're asking here. Do you think there should be an entire class of champions that should just invalidate you "by mere virtue of having a job to do"? Sure, tanks kinda do that if they're full hp and sitting on a good deal of resistances, but if they get softened up, they become a target, too. What if they just magically took literally 0 damage from you ALL the time because "I'm the tank. It's what I do."? It's not me that needs to readjust my vision of balance here. 

Also, adcs only burst your shit in later stages of the game. During the early/mid stages, it's gonna take more than 2-3 clicks to mop you up. Late stages...we'll have that talk in mid season cause I think crit burst is pretty unfun myself.

The issue with supports (Janna Lulu and karma's are the big offenders) is that they have 100% uptime on a 300-600 (maybe even 700) hp shields. That doesn't even give you (as an assassin) room to attempt to outplay. Btw I am in favor of outplayes. I don't care who does it. Its good for the game. It makes it fun and allows you to be skillful. Most assassin's burst for maybe like 500-600 damage extra if played optimally. This leaves an assassin unable to even kill the priority target 100% of the time before factoring in things like exhaust or and other forms of cc/peel. So seriously. Shields need to have durations reduced by about half. Well down to 2 seconds. So it's on the support to shield the damage and play well. Not spam e on cooldown and type '/all outplayed' after the assassin trying to get lucky because he doesn't have a realistic ability to do anything else in a teamfight.

None of the supports you mentioned, save Lulu, have a shield cd that's shorter than their shield duration.

And if you reduce shield value, you just increase *heal* value, which proxy-buffs champs like Nami further, in which case people will say she's op, which I don't want because she isn't, but everything around her is getting nerfed, causing her win rate to climb. >_>

.5 second downtime on Janna and .5-.7 on karma. 

Also no. Not if your actively blocking damage with the shield. Shields should block damage. But you should not have 95-100% uptime on them.

At 30+ minutes into the game when you have a ton of damage sources to deal with, knocking them off as they're applied.

I'm an advocate of putting emphasis on more skill oriented tools in a support's kit, if you ask me, but since we don't have that for Enchanters, it is what it is until further notice.

Obviously being 6-0 at 13mins will mean you can do that but then is the only way for assassins to be a class is to get extremely fed early? that's not very fair since assassins don't provide anything beside damage. Unlike mages who have powerful utility build in which they can use no matter how far behind they get. 

There's a big problem right with assassin itemization which causes them to be extremely useless when behind. This is almost certainly in my opinion because of the rework of Last Whisper and the nerfing of BlackCleaver, mainly LastWhisper though.
